> “*Is modeling?*”

$$
Y_i \text{(Income)} = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \cdot \text{Education}_i + \varepsilon_i
$$

on explanatory variables $X$:

$$
Y \mid X \sim P(Y \mid X; \theta)
$$

Where:

- $Y$ is the **response or dependent variable** (e.g., income),
- $X$ is a vector of **covariates or explanatory variables** (e.g., education, experience),
- $\theta$ represents the **parameters** of the distribution (e.g., regression coefficients).
